metadata.Description: A policy instrument that puts a price on carbon emissions, either through a carbon tax or a cap-and-trade system, to incentivize the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

carbon pricing.Description: Carbon pricing implements energy efficiency policies that incentivize the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.
Carbon pricing funds renewable energy projects that aim to increase the share of clean energy in the energy mix.
Carbon pricing focuses on emission reduction strategies to mitigate climate change.
Carbon pricing plays a role in climate change mitigation efforts by incentivizing the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.
Carbon pricing partners with the private sector to promote sustainable business practices and investments in clean technologies.
Carbon pricing contributes to the achievement of sustainable development goals by promoting clean energy and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Carbon pricing monitors the carbon market to ensure the effectiveness and integrity of emissions trading systems.
Carbon pricing targets high carbon intensity industries to encourage emission reductions and transition to cleaner technologies.
